snippet: The conclusion, by the group’s International Agency for Research on Cancer, was vigorously disputed by the herbicide’s maker, Monsanto.
abstract: World Health Organization's International Agency for Research on Cancers says glyphosate, active ingredient in Roundup herbicide, is probably carcinogenic to humans; Monsanto, which manufactures herbicide, disputes findings.
lead_paragraph: The conclusion, by the group’s International Agency for Research on Cancer, was vigorously disputed by the herbicide’s maker, Monsanto.

headline.main: W.H.O. Report Links Ingredient in Roundup to Cancer
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; W.H.O. Links Ingredient in Roundup to Cancer
